Sizes in LaTeX

29 Sep 2012

Here is an overview of sizes in LaTeX:

TikZ

[caption id="attachment_45911" align="aligncenter" width="500"] TikZ thicknes[/caption] Usage example: \drawultra thick, blue,dashed -- (a);

  • ultra thin
  • very thin
  • thin
  • semithick
  • thick
  • very thick
  • ultra thick

Text

Usage example: \Huge $\varepsilon$

  • \tiny
  • \scriptsize
  • \footnotesize
  • \small
  • \normalsize
  • \large
  • \Large
  • \LARGE
  • \huge
  • \Huge

Math

[caption id="attachment_45931" align="aligncenter" width="309"] Sizes of different math modes[/caption] Usage example: $\scriptstyle \lim_{n \rightarrow \infty} (1 + \frac{1}{n})n$

  • \scriptscriptstyle
  • \scriptstyle
  • \textstyle
  • \displaystyle
